name: Bug Bounty - Scope Reconnaissance
summary: Comprehensive scope reconnaissance workflow for bug bounty programs, including asset discovery, scope validation, attack surface mapping, and compliance verification.
details: This workflow provides a systematic approach to bug bounty scope reconnaissance, ensuring thorough coverage of all in-scope assets while avoiding out-of-scope testing. It combines automated discovery with manual validation to create a complete attack surface map with evidence suitable for bounty program documentation.

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y git python3 python3-pip
sudo apt install -y amass sublist3rtheharvester dnsrecon nmap
pip3 install subfinder assetfinder httpx-tools nuclei

installation_guides.summary: Install with Kali repositories and additional tools

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y amass sublist3r theharvester dnsrecon
sudo apt install -y ffuf gobuster nuclei nmap masscan

notes: Verify which domains are active and in scope
Find and validate active subdomains
Identify cloud-hosted assets for additional testing

steps.title: Program Rules Analysis
steps.details: Read and understand bug bounty program scope, rules, and exclusions
steps.command: # Document scope: domains, IP ranges, mobile apps, APIs, out-of-scope items

steps.title: Scope Asset Inventory
steps.details: Create initial list of all in-scope assets from program description
steps.command: echo -e "*.example.com\napi.example.com\nmobile.example.com" > scope_assets.txt

steps.title: Wildcard Scope Expansion
steps.details: Identify wildcard domains and potential subdomain scope
steps.command: echo "*.example.com" | subfinder -silent | sort -u > potential_scope.txt

steps.title: Scope Compliance Check
steps.details: Verify all discovered assets against program rules
steps.command: # Cross-reference findings with program policy and restrictions

steps.title: Subdomain Enumeration
steps.details: Discover subdomains using multiple passive sources
steps.command: subfinder -d example.com -all -silent | sort -u > subdomains_passive.txt

steps.title: Certificate Transparency Mining
steps.details: Extract subdomains from certificate transparency logs
steps.command: crt.sh -%.example.com | grep -E "\.example.com" | sort -u > ct_subdomains.txt

steps.title: DNS Record Discovery
steps.details: Map DNS infrastructure and related assets
steps.command: dnsrecon -d example.com -t axfr -o dns_records.txt

steps.title: Cloud Asset Discovery
steps.details: Identify cloud-hosted infrastructure and services
steps.command: amass intel -org "Example Company" -active | grep -E "(aws|azure|gcp)" > cloud_assets.txt

steps.title: HTTP/HTTPS Service Discovery
steps.details: Identify active web services on discovered assets
steps.command: cat subdomains_passive.txt | httpx -title -status-code -tech-detect -o active_web_assets.txt

steps.title: Port Service Mapping
steps.details: Map open ports and services on in-scope IP ranges
steps.command: nmap -sS -sV -oA port_scan_$(date +%Y%m%d) target_range

steps.title: Asset Technology Profiling
steps.details: Identify technologies, frameworks, and potential vulnerabilities
steps.command: whatweb -a3 -log-verbose=tech_profile.txt active_web_assets.txt

steps.title: Asset Ownership Verification
steps.details: Confirm asset ownership and scope compliance
steps.command: # Whois lookups, DNS ownership, certificate validation

steps.title: Web Application Mapping
steps.details: Map web application structure and functionality
steps.command: gobuster dir -u https://target.example.com -w common_dirs.txt -o web_structure.txt

steps.title: API Endpoint Discovery
steps.details: Identify API endpoints and documentation
steps.command: curl -s https://target.example.com/ | grep -E "(api|endpoint|rest|graphql)" > api_endpoints.txt

steps.title: Mobile App Analysis
steps.details: Analyze mobile applications for in-app endpoints
steps.command: # Extract APK/IPA, analyze network traffic, identify API calls

steps.title: Third-Party Service Mapping
steps.details: Identify third-party services and dependencies
steps.command: # Check for CDNs, analytics, payment processors, auth providers

steps.title: Asset Inventory Creation
steps.details: Create comprehensive asset inventory with metadata
steps.command: # Spreadsheet with domains, IPs, technologies, owners, scope status

steps.title: Attack Surface Visualization
steps.details: Create visual map of attack surface and relationships
steps.command: # Use diagrams, mind maps, or attack surface tools

steps.title: Scope Compliance Report
steps.details: Document scope compliance and potential edge cases
steps.command: # Report on in-scope assets, out-of-scope items, gray areas

steps.title: Testing Prioritization
steps.details: Prioritize assets based on criticality and vulnerability potential
steps.command: # Rank assets by business impact, technology stack, exposure

stages.label: Setup & Configuration
stages.description: Configure tools, create directory structure, define scope
stages.command: mkdir -p ~/bugbounty/{scope,recon,evidence,reports} && echo "*.example.com" > scope/domains.txt

stages.label: Passive Discovery
stages.description: Gather intelligence without touching target infrastructure
stages.command: subfinder -d example.com -all -silent | sort -u > recon/subdomains.txt && amass enum -d example.com -passive >> recon/subdomains.txt

stages.label: Active Validation
stages.description: Verify discovered assets and map attack surface
stages.command: cat recon/subdomains.txt | httpx -title -status-code -tech-detect -o recon/active_assets.txt

stages.label: Technology Profiling
stages.description: Identify technologies and potential vulnerability vectors
stages.command: whatweb -a3 -log-verbose=recon/tech_profile.txt recon/active_assets.txt && nuclei -l recon/active_assets.txt -o recon/initial_scan.txt

stages.label: Scope Verification
stages.description: Final scope validation and compliance check
stages.command: # Review all findings against program policy, create final scope report

output_notes.meaning: Target has defensive measures, adjust timing and use async scanning
Large potential attack surface, prioritize subdomain enumeration
Additional attack vectors via cloud misconfigurations
Document but do not test, report to program if ambiguous
Include in testing but respect third-party policies

advanced_usage.title: Custom Subdomain Wordlist Generation
advanced_usage.scenario: Generate targeted wordlists based on discovered patterns
advanced_usage.command: cat recon/subdomains.txt | sed 's/.*\.//' | sort -u > base_domains.txt && cat base_domains.txt | crunch 4 8 -f recon/patterns.txt > custom_wordlist.txt
notes: Create patterns from existing subdomains for more effective brute forcing

advanced_usage.title: Permutation-Based Discovery
advanced_usage.scenario: Generate subdomain permutations for comprehensive coverage
notes: Use discovered subdomains as seeds for permutation attacks

advanced_usage.title: Asset Correlation Analysis
advanced_usage.scenario: Correlate assets across multiple programs and organizations
advanced_usage.command: # Cross-reference assets across programs, identify shared infrastructure
notes: Use for multi-program reconnaissance and shared vulnerability impact

resources.description: Comprehensive web application testing methodology

resources.label: Bug Hunter's Methodology
resources.description: ProjectDiscovery bug bounty methodology and tools

resources.label: HackerOne Hacktivity
resources.description: Recent disclosures and bounty trends for scope analysis

resources.description: Educational resources for bug bounty methodologies

name: Bug Bounty - Web Application Testing
summary: Systematic web application security testing workflow for bug bounty programs, covering reconnaissance, vulnerability assessment, exploitation, and responsible disclosure.
details: This workflow provides a comprehensive approach to web application testing in bug bounty programs. It combines automated scanning with manual testing techniques to identify vulnerabilities across the OWASP Top 10 and beyond, with emphasis on high-impact findings and proper evidence collection for bounty submissions.

installation_guides.summary: Install web application testing tools and dependencies

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y git python3 python3-pip curl wget
sudo apt install -y burpsuite owasp-zap nikto gobuster ffuf sqlmap
pip3 install requests beautifulsoup4 selenium paramiko

installation_guides.summary: Install with Kali's comprehensive tool repositories

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y burpsuite owasp-zap nikto gobuster
sudo apt install -y sqlmap nmap ffuf wpscan joomscan nuclei

installation_guides.summary: Complete web testing environment in containers

notes: Focus on high-severity vulnerabilities first
Find hidden directories and files
Basic SQL injection testing with safe parameters

steps.title: Application Technology Stack
steps.details: Identify web server, frameworks, languages, and databases
steps.command: whatweb --log-verbose=tech_stack.txt https://target.example.com && wappalyzer https://target.example.com

steps.title: Application Functionality Mapping
steps.details: Map application features, user flows, and attack surface
steps.command: # Manual browsing, spidering, and functionality documentation

steps.title: API Endpoint Discovery
steps.details: Identify REST, GraphQL, and other API endpoints
steps.command: curl -s https://target.example.com/ | grep -E "(api|rest|graphql|endpoint)" > api_endpoints.txt

steps.title: Security Headers Analysis
steps.details: Check for missing or misconfigured security headers
steps.command: curl -I https://target.example.com | grep -E "(X-Frame|X-XSS|X-Content|CSP|HSTS)"

steps.title: Nuclei Template Scanning
steps.details: Run comprehensive template-based vulnerability scanning
steps.command: nuclei -l targets.txt -t ~/nuclei-templates/ -o nuclei_scan.txt -severity critical,high,medium

steps.title: Nikto Web Vulnerability Scan
steps.details: Identify known vulnerabilities and misconfigurations
steps.command: nikto -h https://target.example.com -o nikko_results.txt -Format txt

steps.title: Directory & File Discovery
steps.details: Find hidden directories, files, and backup files
steps.command: gobuster dir -u https://target.example.com -w ~/wordlists/directory-list-2.3-medium.txt -o dirs_found.txt

steps.title: Parameter Discovery
steps.details: Discover hidden parameters and attack points
steps.command: ffuf -w ~/wordlists/params.txt -u "https://target.example.com/page?FUZZ=value" -mc 200

steps.title: Authentication & Authorization
steps.details: Test authentication bypass, privilege escalation, and access control
steps.command: # Test login bypass, session management, role-based access, JWT manipulation

steps.title: Injection Vulnerabilities
steps.details: Test for SQL, NoSQL, command, and template injection
steps.command: sqlmap -u "https://target.example.com/search?q=test" --batch --level=2 --risk=2

steps.title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
steps.details: Test for reflected, stored, and DOM-based XSS
steps.command: # Use Burp Suite scanner and manual payload testing

steps.title: File Upload & Path Traversal
steps.details: Test file upload restrictions and path traversal vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test various file types, double extensions, directory traversal patterns

steps.title: Business Logic Flaws
steps.details: Identify business logic vulnerabilities and race conditions
steps.command: # Test multi-step workflows, price manipulation, authorization bypasses

steps.title: Client-Side Security
steps.details: Test for client-side vulnerabilities and data exposure
steps.command: # Analyze JavaScript, DOM manipulation, local storage, CSRF tokens

steps.title: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
steps.details: Test for SSRF vulnerabilities in file imports, webhooks, redirects
steps.command: # Test with internal IP addresses, DNS rebinding, cloud metadata endpoints

steps.title: Insecure Direct Object References (IDOR)
steps.details: Test for IDOR vulnerabilities in API endpoints and URLs
steps.command: # Manipulate IDs, UUIDs, and object references in requests

steps.title: Vulnerability Validation
steps.details: Validate and document each finding with proof of concept
steps.command: # Create PoC exploits, screenshots, and detailed evidence

steps.title: Impact Assessment
steps.details: Assess business impact and potential exploit chains
steps.command: # Document data exposure, privilege escalation, system compromise potential

steps.title: Evidence Organization
steps.details: Organize evidence for bounty submission with clear documentation
steps.command: mkdir -p evidence/{vuln_type}/screenshots,pocs,logs

steps.title: Responsible Disclosure
steps.details: Prepare responsible disclosure report with remediation guidance
steps.command: # Write detailed vulnerability report with steps to reproduce and fix

workflow_guides.name: Bug Bounty Web Application Testing Timeline

stages.label: Day 1: Reconnaissance & Profiling
stages.description: Complete application profiling, technology identification, and attack surface mapping
stages.command: whatweb -a3 https://target.example.com && gobuster dir -u https://target.example.com -w common.txt -o day1_recon.txt

stages.label: Day 2: Automated Scanning
stages.description: Run comprehensive automated scans to identify obvious vulnerabilities
stages.command: nuclei -l targets.txt -severity critical,high -o day2_critical.txt && nikto -h https://target.example.com -o day2_nikko.txt

stages.label: Day 3: Manual Testing - Authentication
stages.description: Focus on authentication bypass, session management, and authorization flaws
stages.command: # Configure Burp Suite, test authentication mechanisms, analyze tokens

stages.label: Day 4: Manual Testing - Injection
stages.description: Test for injection vulnerabilities including SQL, XSS, and command injection
stages.command: sqlmap -u "https://target.example.com/vulnerable" --batch && manual XSS testing

stages.label: Day 5: Advanced Testing & Reporting
stages.description: Test business logic, prepare findings, and generate bounty submission
stages.command: # Test edge cases, validate findings, prepare evidence, write report

stages.label: Critical Vulnerability Hunt
stages.description: Focus on high-impact vulnerabilities first
stages.command: nuclei -l targets.txt -severity critical -t cves/ -o triage_critical.txt

stages.label: Authentication Bypass Testing
stages.description: Quick test for common authentication flaws
stages.command: # Test default credentials, SQL injection in login, JWT manipulation

stages.label: Injection Vector Discovery
stages.description: Identify and test injection points
stages.command: ffuf -w params.txt -u "https://target.example.com/search?FUZZ=test" -mc 200

stages.label: Business Logic Testing
stages.description: Test for logic flaws in core functionality
stages.command: # Test price manipulation, race conditions, workflow bypasses

stages.label: Evidence Collection
stages.description: Document and validate findings for submission
stages.command: # Create PoC, screenshots, and detailed vulnerability report

output_notes.meaning: Critical vulnerability with potential data breach impact
Client-side vulnerability with phishing potential
Complete account compromise possible
Remote code execution on server
Internal network access and data exfiltration
Brute force attacks possible

advanced_usage.title: Custom Nuclei Template Development
advanced_usage.scenario: Create custom templates for application-specific vulnerabilities
advanced_usage.command: # Create YAML templates for business logic flaws and custom endpoints
notes: Develop targeted templates for unique application functionality

advanced_usage.title: Burp Suite Intruder Automation
advanced_usage.scenario: Automate parameter fuzzing and attack payloads
advanced_usage.command: # Use Intruder with custom payloads for comprehensive testing
notes: Create custom payload lists based on application context

advanced_usage.title: Race Condition Testing
advanced_usage.scenario: Test for race conditions in critical workflows
advanced_usage.command: # Use threading tools to send concurrent requests
notes: Focus on payment processing, password reset, and registration flows

resources.description: Free web security training and labs

resources.description: Recent disclosures and bounty trends

name: Bug Bounty - Mobile Application Testing
summary: Comprehensive mobile application security testing workflow for bug bounty programs, covering iOS, Android, and hybrid applications with static analysis, dynamic testing, and API security.
details: This workflow provides a systematic approach to mobile application security testing in bug bounty programs. It covers static analysis of application binaries, dynamic testing of running applications, network traffic analysis, and backend API testing, with emphasis on mobile-specific vulnerabilities and proper evidence collection.

installation_guides.summary: Install mobile testing tools and Android SDK

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y git python3 python3-pip default-jdk
pip3 install frida-tools objection mobsec dllib

installation_guides.summary: Install with Kali's mobile security tools

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y android-tools-adb android-tools-fastboot
sudo apt install -y gdb radare2 apktool jadx drozer

installation_guides.summary: Mobile Security Framework (MobSF) and analysis tools

notes: Extract hardcoded secrets and sensitive data
Monitor network traffic and SSL configurations

quick_examples.command: objection -g com.example.app explore android sslpinning disable
notes: Bypass SSL pinning for traffic interception

steps.title: Application Acquisition
steps.details: Obtain mobile application from app stores or direct download
steps.command: # Download APK/IPA, note version, release date, and changelog

steps.title: Emulator/Device Setup
steps.details: Configure Android emulator or physical device for testing
steps.command: emulator -avd test_device -no-snapshot-load || adb devices

steps.title: Tool Installation
steps.details: Install and configure mobile testing tools and frameworks
steps.command: pip3 install frida-tools objection && adb shell settings put global airplane_mode_on 0

steps.title: Proxy Configuration
steps.details: Configure network proxy for traffic interception
steps.command: # Set up Burp Suite/ZAP mobile proxy and install CA certificate

steps.title: Binary Analysis
steps.details: Analyze application binary for embedded secrets and configurations
steps.command: jadx -d static_analysis app.apk && grep -r -i "password\|api_key\|secret" static_analysis/

steps.title: Manifest Analysis
steps.details: Analyze AndroidManifest.xml for security misconfigurations
steps.command: aapt dump badging app.apk > manifest_analysis.txt && apktool d app.apk

steps.title: Code Review
steps.details: Review decompiled code for security vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Look for hardcoded credentials, weak cryptography, insecure storage

steps.title: MobSF Automated Analysis
steps.details: Run comprehensive automated static analysis
steps.command: # Upload APK to MobSF for detailed security assessment

steps.title: Runtime Hooking
steps.details: Use Frida to hook and monitor application behavior
steps.command: objection -g com.example.app explore android heap search instances string

steps.title: Filesystem Analysis
steps.details: Examine application storage and data handling
steps.command: objection -g com.example.app explore android ls /data/data/com.example.app

steps.title: Keychain/Keystore Analysis
steps.details: Analyze secure storage mechanisms and key management
steps.command: # Test keychain access, encrypted data storage, certificate pinning

steps.title: Biometric Authentication Testing
steps.details: Test biometric authentication bypasses and fallback mechanisms
steps.command: # Test face ID/fingerprint bypass and alternative authentication methods

steps.title: SSL/TLS Configuration
steps.details: Test SSL/TLS implementation and certificate validation
steps.command: objection -g com.example.app explore android sslpinning disable

steps.title: API Endpoint Discovery
steps.details: Identify and analyze backend API endpoints
steps.command: frida-trace -U -f com.example.app -i "*HTTP*" -o api_calls.txt

steps.title: Network Traffic Analysis
steps.details: Intercept and analyze network traffic for vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Use Burp Suite/ZAP to analyze API calls, headers, and data

steps.title: Authentication Token Analysis
steps.details: Analyze authentication tokens and session management
steps.command: # Examine JWT tokens, session cookies, and API key handling

steps.title: API Security Testing
steps.details: Test backend APIs for common vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test injection, broken authentication, excessive data exposure

steps.title: Rate Limiting Testing
steps.details: Test API rate limiting and abuse prevention
steps.command: # Test with automated tools for rate limit bypass

steps.title: Business Logic Testing
steps.details: Test mobile-specific business logic vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test in-app purchases, user actions, workflow bypasses

steps.title: Cross-Platform Consistency
steps.details: Verify security controls across iOS and Android platforms
steps.command: # Compare API implementations and security controls

stages.label: Day 1: Setup & Static Analysis
stages.description: Environment setup, application acquisition, and static code analysis
stages.command: jadx -d day1_decompiled app.apk && mobsf-static-analysis app.apk

stages.label: Day 2: Dynamic Local Testing
stages.description: Runtime analysis, filesystem examination, and local storage testing
stages.command: objection -g com.example.app explore android heap search instances password

stages.label: Day 3: Network Analysis
stages.description: SSL bypass, traffic interception, and API endpoint discovery
stages.command: objection -g com.example.app explore android sslpinning disable && frida-trace -U -f com.example.app -i "*HTTP*"

stages.label: Day 4: Backend API Testing
stages.description: Comprehensive API security testing and business logic analysis
stages.command: # Test discovered API endpoints for injection, auth bypass, and data exposure

stages.label: Day 5: Cross-Platform & Reporting
stages.description: Cross-platform testing and vulnerability report preparation
stages.command: # Test iOS equivalent, document findings, prepare bounty submission

output_notes.meaning: Backend API access possible, potential data breach
Network traffic can be intercepted and modified
Sensitive data accessible to other apps or root users
Account takeover and unauthorized access possible
Authentication mechanisms can be circumvented
Code analysis easier, may expose internal logic

advanced_usage.title: Custom Frida Scripts
advanced_usage.scenario: Develop custom Frida scripts for application-specific testing
advanced_usage.command: # Create JavaScript hooks for custom encryption and protocols
notes: Target proprietary protocols and custom security implementations

advanced_usage.title: LLVM Pass Analysis
advanced_usage.scenario: Use LLVM passes for advanced static analysis
advanced_usage.command: # Compile with LLVM instrumentation for data flow analysis
notes: Advanced static analysis for complex applications

advanced_usage.title: Emulator Detection Bypass
advanced_usage.scenario: Bypass emulator detection for dynamic analysis
advanced_usage.command: # Modify system properties and hook detection methods
notes: Enable testing on emulated environments

name: Bug Bounty - API Testing
summary: Comprehensive API security testing workflow for bug bounty programs, covering REST, GraphQL, and SOAP APIs with authentication, authorization, and business logic vulnerability assessment.
details: This workflow provides a systematic approach to API security testing in bug bounty programs. It covers API discovery, authentication testing, authorization bypass, injection vulnerabilities, business logic flaws, and API-specific attacks, with emphasis on proper evidence collection and responsible disclosure.

installation_guides.summary: Install API testing tools and frameworks

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y git python3 python3-pip curl jq

installation_guides.summary: Install with Kali's API testing tools

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y burpsuite owasp-zap postman
sudo apt install -y sqlmap nikto gobuster nuclei

installation_guides.summary: API testing environment with specialized tools

notes: Extract API endpoints from HTML and JavaScript responses
Test authentication endpoints with various credentials
Extract GraphQL schema for endpoint discovery

steps.title: Endpoint Discovery
steps.details: Discover API endpoints from documentation, source code, and crawling
steps.command: curl -s https://target.example.com/ | grep -E "(api|v1|v2|rest|graphql)" > api_endpoints.txt

steps.title: API Documentation Analysis
steps.details: Analyze available API documentation and specifications
steps.command: # Review Swagger/OpenAPI docs, Postman collections, API gateways

steps.title: JavaScript Analysis
steps.details: Extract API calls from frontend JavaScript code
steps.command: # Analyze bundled JS files, network calls, and API configurations

steps.title: Mobile App API Analysis
steps.details: Extract API endpoints from mobile applications
steps.command: # Decompile mobile apps, analyze network traffic, extract API calls

steps.title: Authentication Mechanism Analysis
steps.details: Identify and test authentication mechanisms
steps.command: curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"username":"test","password":"test"}' https://api.target.com/auth/login

steps.title: Token Analysis
steps.details: Analyze JWT tokens, API keys, and session management
steps.command: # Decode JWT tokens, test token manipulation, analyze token expiration

steps.title: Authorization Bypass Testing
steps.details: Test for authorization bypass and privilege escalation
steps.command: # Test with different user roles, manipulate user IDs, test admin endpoints

steps.title: OAuth/OpenID Testing
steps.details: Test OAuth/OpenID implementations for vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test redirect URIs, scope manipulation, token leakage

steps.title: SQL Injection Testing
steps.details: Test for SQL injection in API parameters and body
steps.command: curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"id":"1\' OR 1=1--"}' https://api.target.com/users

steps.title: NoSQL Injection Testing
steps.details: Test for NoSQL injection in MongoDB and other NoSQL databases
steps.command: curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"username":{"$ne":""},"password":{"$ne":""}}' https://api.target.com/auth/login

steps.title: Command Injection Testing
steps.details: Test for command injection in API parameters
steps.command: curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"file":"test.txt; whoami"}' https://api.target.com/files

steps.title: XXE & XML Injection
steps.details: Test for XXE and XML injection in XML-based APIs
steps.command: # Test with malicious XML payloads, external entity injection

steps.title: Rate Limiting Testing
steps.details: Test API rate limiting and abuse prevention
steps.command: # Test with automated requests, parallel threads, timing attacks

steps.title: Business Logic Flaws
steps.details: Test for business logic vulnerabilities in API workflows
steps.command: # Test price manipulation, race conditions, workflow bypasses

steps.title: Mass Assignment Testing
steps.details: Test for mass assignment vulnerabilities in object creation
steps.command: # Test with additional parameters, role assignment, status changes

steps.title: Resource Enumeration
steps.details: Test for insecure direct object references and enumeration
steps.command: # Test sequential IDs, UUID enumeration, resource guessing

steps.title: GraphQL Introspection
steps.details: Extract and analyze GraphQL schema and queries
steps.command: curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"query":"{__schema{queryType{fields{name}}}}"}' https://api.target.com/graphql

steps.title: GraphQL Injection Testing
steps.details: Test for GraphQL-specific injection vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test malicious queries, introspection abuse, field duplication

steps.title: SOAP API Testing
steps.details: Test SOAP APIs for XML-based vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test XXE, XML injection, WSDL analysis

steps.title: WebSocket API Testing
steps.details: Test WebSocket endpoints for authentication and injection
steps.command: # Test WebSocket authentication, message injection, DoS

stages.label: Day 1: Discovery & Mapping
stages.description: Complete API endpoint discovery and documentation analysis
stages.command: curl -s https://target.example.com/ | jq -r '.links[].href' > day1_endpoints.txt

stages.label: Day 2: Authentication Testing

name: Bug Bounty - OWASP Top 10 Sweep
summary: Systematic OWASP Top 10 vulnerability assessment workflow for bug bounty programs, providing comprehensive coverage of the most critical web application security risks with targeted testing and evidence collection.
details: This workflow provides a structured approach to testing for OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities in bug bounty programs. It covers the 2021 OWASP Top 10 categories with specific testing methodologies, automated tools, and manual testing techniques to identify high-impact vulnerabilities commonly found in web applications.

installation_guides.summary: Install OWASP Top 10 testing tools and dependencies

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y git python3 python3-pip curl jq
sudo apt install -y burpsuite owasp-zap nikto sqlmap nuclei

installation_guides.summary: Install with Kali's comprehensive security tools

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y burpsuite owasp-zap nikto sqlmap
sudo apt install -y gobuster ffuf wpscan nuclei testssl

installation_guides.summary: OWASP Top 10 testing environment with specialized tools

notes: Test for authorization bypass with invalid tokens
Quick SQL injection test with safe parameters
Scan for common security misconfigurations

steps.title: Authorization Bypass Testing
steps.details: Test for authorization bypass in sensitive endpoints
steps.command: # Test admin endpoints with regular user tokens, manipulate user IDs

steps.title: Privilege Escalation
steps.details: Test for privilege escalation vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test role manipulation, parameter pollution, metadata tampering

steps.title: Insecure Direct Object References
steps.details: Test for IDOR vulnerabilities in API endpoints
steps.command: # Manipulate IDs, UUIDs, and object references in URLs and parameters

steps.title: Bypassing Business Logic
steps.details: Test for business logic bypasses in authorization checks
steps.command: # Test workflow bypasses, race conditions, state manipulation

steps.title: Weak Encryption Testing
steps.details: Test for weak cryptographic implementations
steps.command: # Test for weak ciphers, improper key management, hardcoded keys

steps.title: Sensitive Data Exposure
steps.details: Test for sensitive data in transit and at rest
steps.command: # Check for passwords, tokens, PII in responses, logs, storage

steps.title: TLS/SSL Configuration
steps.details: Test for weak TLS/SSL configurations
steps.command: testssl.sh https://target.example.com | grep -E "(weak|vulnerable)"

steps.title: Hash Implementation
steps.details: Test for weak hashing algorithms and salt usage
steps.command: # Test password storage, hash cracking, rainbow table attacks

steps.title: SQL Injection Testing
steps.details: Comprehensive SQL injection testing across all parameters
steps.command: sqlmap -u "https://target.com/search?q=test" --batch --level=3 --risk=2

steps.title: NoSQL Injection Testing
steps.details: Test NoSQL injection in MongoDB and other NoSQL databases
steps.command: # Test JSON-based injection, operator injection, blind NoSQL injection

steps.title: Command Injection Testing
steps.details: Test for OS command injection vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test semicolon injection, pipe injection, backtick injection

steps.title: Template Injection Testing
steps.details: Test for server-side template injection vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test Jinja2, Twig, Handlebars template injection payloads

steps.title: Business Logic Flaws
steps.details: Test for business logic vulnerabilities in application design
steps.command: # Test race conditions, workflow bypasses, logic flaw exploitation

steps.title: Missing Authorization
steps.details: Test for missing authorization in critical operations
steps.command: # Test password reset, email change, account deletion without auth

steps.title: Unsafe Resource Consumption
steps.details: Test for resource exhaustion and DoS vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test file upload limits, request size limits, CPU/memory exhaustion

steps.title: Insecure Workflows
steps.details: Test for insecure multi-step workflows and transactions
steps.command: # Test payment processing, user registration, data import workflows

steps.title: Default Credentials Testing
steps.details: Test for default credentials and configuration files
steps.command: # Test admin/admin, default passwords, config file exposure

steps.title: Directory Listing
steps.details: Test for directory listing and file exposure
steps.command: curl -I https://target.com/uploads/ | grep -E "(200|Index of)"

steps.title: Security Headers Analysis
steps.details: Test for missing or misconfigured security headers
steps.command: curl -I https://target.com | grep -E "(X-Frame|X-XSS|CSP|HSTS)"

steps.title: Cloud Misconfigurations
steps.details: Test for cloud service misconfigurations
steps.command: # Test S3 buckets, cloud storage, metadata endpoints

steps.title: Software Version Detection
steps.details: Identify outdated software and vulnerable versions
steps.command: whatweb --log-verbose=versions.txt https://target.com && nuclei -l targets.txt -t cves/

steps.title: Dependency Analysis
steps.details: Analyze JavaScript dependencies for known vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test package.json, npm audit, dependency confusion

steps.title: Component Exploitation
steps.details: Test for exploitable vulnerabilities in components
steps.command: # Test CVE exploits, public exploits, proof-of-concept attacks

steps.title: Supply Chain Security
steps.details: Test for supply chain vulnerabilities in third-party components
steps.command: # Test dependency confusion, malicious packages, typosquatting

steps.title: Authentication Bypass
steps.details: Test for authentication mechanism bypasses
steps.command: # Test SQL injection in login, JWT manipulation, session fixation

steps.title: Weak Password Policies
steps.details: Test for weak password policies and recovery mechanisms
steps.command: # Test password complexity, reset tokens, recovery bypasses

steps.title: Session Management
steps.details: Test for insecure session management
steps.command: # Test session fixation, hijacking, prediction, invalidation

steps.title: Multi-Factor Authentication
steps.details: Test MFA implementation for bypasses and weaknesses
steps.command: # Test MFA bypass, backup codes, social engineering resistance

step_sequences.title: A08: Software and Data Integrity Failures

steps.title: Insecure Deserialization
steps.details: Test for insecure deserialization vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test JSON, XML, binary deserialization attacks

steps.title: Code Injection
steps.details: Test for code injection vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test eval injection, template injection, expression language injection

steps.title: Software Supply Chain
steps.details: Test for software supply chain integrity issues
steps.command: # Test CI/CD pipeline security, code signing, update mechanisms

steps.title: CORS Misconfiguration
steps.details: Test for CORS misconfiguration vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test wildcard origins, credential leakage, preflight cache poisoning

step_sequences.title: A09: Security Logging and Monitoring Failures

steps.title: Logging Deficiencies
steps.details: Test for inadequate logging and monitoring
steps.command: # Test log injection, log deletion, log tampering

steps.title: Event Monitoring
steps.details: Test for insufficient event monitoring and alerting
steps.command: # Test attack detection, anomaly detection, incident response

steps.title: Audit Trail Gaps
steps.details: Test for missing or incomplete audit trails
steps.command: # Test user action logging, data access logging, change tracking

steps.title: Alerting Mechanisms
steps.details: Test for inadequate alerting and notification systems
steps.command: # Test alert fatigue, false positives, missed attacks

steps.title: SSRF Discovery
steps.details: Identify potential SSRF vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test file imports, webhooks, redirects, URL parameters

steps.title: Internal Network Access
steps.details: Test for internal network access via SSRF
steps.command: # Test localhost access, internal IP ranges, cloud metadata

steps.title: Cloud Metadata Access
steps.details: Test for cloud metadata service access
steps.command: # Test AWS metadata, GCP metadata, Azure metadata endpoints

steps.title: Blind SSRF
steps.details: Test for blind SSRF vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test out-of-band techniques, DNS exfiltration, time delays

stages.label: Day 1: A01-A02 Critical Testing
stages.description: Focus on Broken Access Control and Cryptographic Failures
stages.command: # Test authorization bypass, privilege escalation, crypto failures

stages.label: Day 2: A03-A04 Injection & Design
stages.description: Comprehensive injection testing and insecure design analysis
stages.command: sqlmap -u "https://target.com/search?q=test" --batch && business_logic_testing

stages.label: Day 3: A05-A06 Configuration & Components
stages.description: Security misconfigurations and vulnerable components assessment
stages.command: nuclei -l targets.txt -t misconfig/ && nuclei -l targets.txt -t cves/

stages.label: Day 4: A07-A08 Authentication & Integrity
stages.description: Authentication failures and software integrity testing
stages.command: # Test auth bypass, session management, deserialization attacks

stages.label: Day 5: A09-A10 Monitoring & SSRF
stages.description: Logging failures and SSRF vulnerability testing
stages.command: # Test logging gaps, monitoring issues, SSRF exploitation

stages.label: Critical Vulnerability Hunt
stages.description: Quick scan for critical OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities
stages.command: nuclei -l targets.txt -severity critical -t owasp/ -o critical_owasp.txt

stages.label: Authentication & Authorization
stages.description: Test A01 and A07 vulnerabilities
stages.command: # Test auth bypass, privilege escalation, session management

stages.label: Injection Testing
stages.description: Test A03 injection vulnerabilities
stages.command: sqlmap -u "https://target.com/search?q=test" --batch --level=2

stages.label: Configuration & SSRF
stages.description: Test A05 and A10 vulnerabilities
stages.command: # Test misconfigurations, SSRF, internal access

stages.label: Evidence Collection
stages.description: Document findings and prepare bounty submission
stages.command: # Organize evidence, create PoC, write detailed report

output_notes.indicator: A01 - Admin access with regular user token
output_notes.meaning: Complete system compromise possible via authorization bypass
Data breach and privacy violation risk
Database access and data extraction possible
Business logic bypass and financial impact
Unauthorized system access
Internal network access and data exfiltration

name: Bug Bounty - Reporting & CVSS
summary: Comprehensive vulnerability reporting and CVSS scoring workflow for bug bounty programs, covering evidence collection, impact assessment, risk scoring, and professional report generation.
details: This workflow provides a systematic approach to vulnerability reporting in bug bounty programs. It covers evidence collection, CVSS scoring, impact assessment, professional report writing, and communication strategies to ensure successful bounty submissions and effective remediation guidance.

installation_guides.summary: Install reporting tools and CVSS calculators

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y git python3 python3-pip markdown
pip3 install jinja2 markdown2 pillow requests

installation_guides.summary: Install with Kali's reporting and documentation tools

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y dradis faraday markdown

notes: Calculate CVSS score for vulnerability assessment
Generate professional vulnerability report
Organize evidence for professional reporting

steps.command: python3 -c "import cvss; print(cvss.CVSS3('CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H').score())"
